tr.td:
name
81-9371: The content of name **SHALL** be either a conformant Patient Name (PTN.US.FIELDED), or a string (CONF:81-9371).
81-9372: The string **SHALL NOT** contain name parts (CONF:81-9372).

description.value: The US Realm Clinical Document Person Name datatype flavor is a set of reusable constraints that can be used for Persons.

definition.value: A name for a person. A sequence of name parts, such as given name or family name, prefix, suffix, etc. Examples for person name values are "Jim Bob Walton, Jr.", "Adam Everyman", etc. A person name may be as simple as a character string or may consist of several person name parts, such as, "Jim", "Bob", "Walton", and "Jr.". PN differs from EN because the qualifier type cannot include LS (Legal Status).
If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.

A set of codes advising a system or user which name in a set of like names to select for a given purpose. A name without specific use code might be a default name useful for any purpose, but a name with a specific use code would be preferred for that respective purpose
An interval of time specifying the time during which the name is or was used for the entity. This accomodates the fact that people change names for people, places and things.

human.value: The content of name **SHALL** be either a conformant Patient Name (PTN.US.FIELDED), or a string (CONF:81-9371).
The string **SHALL NOT** contain name parts (CONF:81-9372).
